comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Coaticook, Quebec -- site of his extradition trial: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9404E2DB123FE6...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In 1950, in a special issue reviewing the history of the first half of the 20th century, LIFE magazine devoted several pages to the sensational scandals that surrounded the trials of Millionaire Harry K. Thaw for the murder of Architect Stanford White. He escaped from an asylum for the criminally insane in August, 1913, and fled across the border from New York State to Quebec, but was extradited and sent back to the asylum, only to be released two years later.
